means: 互相连接，互相联系( interconnect的过去式和过去分词)

sentence.Network_en: The regions are interconnected by an excellent highway system.
sentence.Network_cn: 那些地区通过完善的公路系统相互连接。

sentence.Network_en: The sub-plots are only tenuously interconnected.
sentence.Network_cn: 次要情节之间的联系有点牵强。

sentence.Network_en: Bad housing is interconnected with debt and poverty.
sentence.Network_cn: 住房条件差与负债以及贫困相关联。

entry.def: Things that interconnect or are interconnected are connected to or with each other. You can also say that one thing interconnects with another.

example.ex: The causes are many and may interconnect...
example.tran: 原因有很多而且可能互相关联。

example.ex: Their lives interconnect with those of celebrated figures of the late eighteenth-century...
example.tran: 他们的生活与18世纪晚期的名人联系在一起。

auth_sentence.content: Human society is highly interconnected globally at this point.
auth_sentence.res_content: Human society is highly interconnected globally at this point.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Human society is highly interconnected globally at this point.

auth_sentence.content: Reconfiguring a widely interconnected system is a daunting challenge, though.
auth_sentence.res_content: Reconfiguring a widely interconnected system is a daunting challenge, though.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Reconfiguring a widely interconnected system is a daunting challenge, though.

auth_sentence.content: In many cases, the various Millennium Development Goals are interconnected.
auth_sentence.res_content: In many cases, the various Millennium Development Goals are interconnected.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In many cases, the various Millennium Development Goals are interconnected.

Sentence.sentence: The ultimate social network is still being mapped out, but Christakis says: "People are interconnected, so their health is interconnected.
